content:
• Friday, June 5, 2015
  • AMBA

    Ambarella +12% post-earnings; Street sees major drone opportunity

    • Though the initial response to Tuesday afternoon's FQ1 beat and strong FQ2 guidance was muted, Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) has steadily risen since. Shares rose 3% today to $103.33, making new highs yet again. They're now up 104% YTD.
    • Since the results/guidance, Ambarella's FY16 (ends Jan. '16) and FY17 consensus estimates have respectively risen to $3.04 and $3.65 from $2.28 and $2.89. Needham has upgraded to Hold, and (not surprisingly, given the numbers and YTD performance) many other have hiked their targets.
    • The subject of much analyst enthusiasm: Ambarella stated on its CC (transcript) it expects drone-related video processor sales to account for over 10% of revenue for the first time in FQ2, thanks partly to new product launches. Top client GoPro plans to launch a drone in 1H16.
    • Pac Crest's Brad Erickson (Overweight rating) thinks the FQ2 guidance implies ~400K drone SoC shipments. "Pretty impressive for a market that we think did roughly a half a million units total all last year." He also thinks Ambarella is reaping a ~75% gross margin on the shipments; FQ2 total GM guidance is at 63.5%-65%.
    • Canaccord's Matt Ramsay hiked his target by $29 to $115. "Ambarella’s portfolio of highly differentiated application-specific video encode, compression, and analytics processors positions the company for strong sales and earnings growth ... we believe Ambarella’s investments in video analytics will prove significantly undervalued and provide sustained long-term differentiation and pricing stability."
    • Those less bullish, such as Dougherty's Charles Anderson (Neutral), often cite valuation. "[S]hares are currently trading 6.5x [EV/sales] on our new FY17 estimate of $400MM ... While we acknowledge Ambarella’s prowess in algorithms and potential future tilt toward analytics software, it is just difficult for us to want to pay these multiples for a semiconductor company."
     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 PM | 11 Comments
  • WLT

    Bloomberg: Walter Energy negotiating bankruptcy deal

    • Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) -4.2% AH after a Bloomberg reports says the coal miner is negotiating a debt restructuring with senior lenders that could put it into bankruptcy as soon as this month.
    • WLT reportedly will send a revised plan to first-lien lenders that includes a request for a debtor-in-possession loan that would allow it to operate while in bankruptcy.
    • WLT has been in talks with lenders for nearly two months on a reorganization as it struggles amid the coal downturn.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:21 PM | 16 Comments
  • DISH

    Dish/T-Mobile: An easier path, but should Verizon get involved?

    • The current wisdom holds that Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) and T-Mobile's (NASDAQ:TMUS) combination bid might have a relatively easy time with regulators, and it shouldn't face debt problems either, says one analyst.
    • “Dish bond covenants are very loose,” says Covenant Review analyst Scott Josefsberg, and the satellite provider would have “wide latitude to structure a transaction." Meanwhile, T-Mobile covenants allow for the firm to issue at least $10B more in debt. Dish Network has an enterprise value of $45.8B; T-Mobile's is $52.9B.
    • Meanwhile, Citigroup's Michael Rollins says the other option is clear for spectrum-rich Dish: Sell itself to Verizon (NYSE:VZ).
    • He thinks that's the likely outcome for a number of reasons, including the need for Verizon to keep up with AT&T/DirecTV, the spectrum shortage that Verizon currently faces heading into next year's incentive auction, and the chance for Dish to make a shift to IP video to "dramatically" increase magnitude and duration of video cash flows.
    • He has Dish and T-Mobile rated at Buy and raised T-Mobile's price target to $46, while maintaining Dish's target at $94. Today: DISH +1.7% to $75.51; TMUS +2.3% to $40.24; VZ -1.8% to $47.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM | 6 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: PLAY +3.1%. KMPH +3.0%. SUPN +2.4%. DRNA +1.7%. EXXI +1.2%.
    • Top losers: MRD -10.5%. CDNA -3.2%. OTC:ANTH -2.5%. SCMP -2.4%. PDLI -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • LITB

    LightInTheBox closes down 3.1% after Q1 beat, soft Q2 guidance

    • Though it beat Q1 estimates, LightInTheBox (NYSE:LITB) has guided for Q2 revenue of $78M-$81M, down from Q1's $87.6M and the year-ago period's $89.8M, and below a sole analyst estimate of $106.8M.
    • Thanks partly to a weak euro, European sales (61.9% of total sales) rose just 0.2% Y/Y in Q1. However, North American sales (25.5% of total) rose 36.2%. Sales to all other markets rose 0.4%.
    • Business performance: Apparel sales +29.6% Y/Y to $31.7M; general merchandise sales -2% to $55.9M. Orders +43.6% to 2.8M; customers +32.4% to 2M. Mobile accounted for 30.4% of revenue.
    • Financials: Thanks to forex, gross margin fell to 34% from 35.2% in Q4 and 41.3% a year ago. Operating expenses rose 21% Y/Y to $51.2M. LightInTheBox ended Q1 with $67.7M in cash, and no debt.
    • CEO Alan Guo says LightInTheBox is "actively considering opportunities for strategic business alliances and partnerships to further strengthen our business growth prospects."
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • DEO

    Diageo jumps on report of potential takeover offer

    • Brazil's Veja reports local P-E firm 3G Capital is considering a bid for Diageo (NYSE:DEO). The liquor giant's shares surged during the final hour of trading, closing up 8%.
    • 3G, known for buying companies possessing popular consumer brands and engaging in ruthless cost-cutting afterwards, is said to be in the early stages of weighing an acquisition. The firm is less than 3 months removed from striking a deal to merge existing holding H.J. Heinz with Kraft Foods.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 21 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: IWC +2.39%. BRF +2.18%. DBA +1.97%. EWZ +1.39%. IJS +1.22%.
    • Losers: EWA -4.66%. EPI -4.18%. TLT -4.18%. GAZ -4.17%. IDU -4.07%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • NLY

    Rough session for mortgage REITs as yields crank higher

    • The 10-year yield is up nine basis points to 2.40% and a September rate hike looks to be in play after the BLS reported a job gain of 280K in May and Y/Y wage growth of 2.3%.
    • Annaly Capital (NLY -1.2%), American Capital Agency (AGNC -2.3%), Armour Residential (ARR -2.7%), Two Harbors (TWO -2.4%), CYS Investments (CYS -1.4%), Hatteras (HTS -1.5%), New York Mortgage (NYMT -1.2%), Capstead Mortgage (CMO -1.4%), MFA Financial (MFA -1.6%), Anworth (ANH -1.8%), Dynex (DX -1.2%).
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, MORT, LMBS
    • Previously: Financials on the move as rate hike draws nearer (June 5)
    • Previously: Jobs up 280K in May; UE rate ticks higher (June 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 89 Comments
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar, ReneSola lose EU tariff exemptions

    • The European Union has applied sharp tariffs on Chinese solar-panel makers Canadian Solar (CSIQ +5.5%), ReneSola (SOL +8.8%) and ET Solar, kicking the companies out of a pact with the Chinese industry that allowed them to export to Europe with minimal tariffs.
    • The three companies were found to be in violation of the 2013 agreement that required the export of solar panels above a minimum price and abide by several other conditions.
    • Among other violations, CSIQ was charged with offering unreported benefits to its customers in Europe to buy their panels, effectively lowering the sales price below the minimum import-price set by the agreement.
    • Earlier: Solar stocks rally following JA's buyout offer, Yingli's results
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 4 Comments
  • TUBE

    TubeMogul, ad-tech companies up strong after Visible World buy

    • TubeMogul (NASDAQ:TUBE) is peaking for the day late, now up 7.9% with a leg up to just under $17/share.
    • The stock has nearly regained what it's lost since Monday's announcement of a follow-on share offering.
    • What might be driving today's action? Comcast sealed a deal yesterday to buy ad-target firm Visible World, which could be a precursor for firms wanting to purchase the real-time bidding that is TubeMogul's specialty.
    • Other ad-tech firms up today with steady climbs: The Rubicon Project (NYSE:RUBI), up 6.3%; Criteo (NASDAQ:CRTO) up 2.6% and making a new 52-week high today.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • WHZT

    Whiting USA Trust II surges 10% after Raymond James upgrade

    • Whiting USA Trust II (WHZ +10.4%) is upgraded to Outperform from Underperform with a $4.50 price target at Raymond James, which considers the recent sharp selloff overdone and that the price has moved too far into bearish territory.
    • The firm expects WHZ's distributions to increase steadily throughout the year after Q1 fell to $0.01/unit from $0.33 in Q4 2014; WHZ's production is heavily weighted towards oil (77%), and the last remaining hedges rolled off in Q1, so the Q1 distribution bore the full brunt of the decline in oil prices, which damaged the stock performance.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • ANET

    Arista +4.7%; Pac Crest hikes target, reports positive checks

    • Pac Crest's Brent Bracelin has hiked his Arista (NYSE:ANET) target by $8 to $88, while reiterating an Outperform.
    • Bracelin: "Field work this week with cloud customers and channel partners increases our confidence that Arista is poised for upside in 2H15 and into 2016 based on: 1) new data center construction activity at Apple, Microsoft, Facebook and Google; and 2) broader channel distribution through HP and Supermicro." Arista is two days removed from announcing a partnership with HP; a deal with Super Micro was announced in March.
    • He adds "accelerating workload migration to public clouds like Microsoft's Azure and Amazon.com's Amazon Web Services and increasing investments in hybrid alternatives is contributing to a substantial increase in new data center construction." Microsoft has long been a major Arista client.
    • Though still below a post-IPO high of $94.84, shares have made fresh 2015 highs. Gabelli provided a bullish note a week ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk, Infoblox, A10 up strongly following federal hack

    • Though not security pure-plays, Splunk (SPLK +5%), Infoblox (BLOX +4.5%), and A10 Networks (ATEN +4.9%) have joined those companies that are (previous) in rallying after a major federal personnel records hack (believed to originate in China) was disclosed. The Nasdaq is up 0.2%.
    • Splunk stated on last month's earnings CC (transcript) security analytics use cases account for about a third of its FQ1 business. The company added it booked its first 7-figure security-only deal during the quarter.
    • Infoblox mentioned on its FQ3 CC (transcript) security sales contribute to its 32% Y/Y product growth, and that it performed over 260 security assessments using its internal DNS security solution (up over 60% Q/Q). A10 has seen healthy growth for its Thunder TPS appliances (used to thwart DDoS attacks), as well as for security features attached to its Thunder application delivery controllers (ADCs).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • NEWM

    New Media Investment Group down 10.5% following newspaper buy

    • Investors are bailing out of New Media Investment Group (NEWM -10.5%) today on no apparent news.
    • Trading volumes are running more than 8 times average at 2.18M shares today.
    • The company on Wednesday came to a deal to buy The Columbus Dispatch newspaper along with weekly papers, magazines and distribution.
    • And yesterday, New Media Investment CEO Mike Reed briefed the newspaper staff about the prospect of job cuts, saying the paper would be cutting staff but without detailing exactly where. New Media unit GateHouse media has a reputation for buying papers and slashing staff.
    • Meanwhile, Moody's says that New Media's acquisition of the paper has no immediate impact on its ratings.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 7 Comments
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining sells New Zealand mine for $101M

    • Newmont Mining (NEM -3.7%) agrees to sell its Waihi operations in New Zealand to OceanaGold (OTCPK:OCANF) for $101M, in a deal NEM says strengthens its balance sheet and gives it more financial flexibility.
    • The deal also includes a $5M contingent payment and a 1% net smelter royalty on a recent discovery north of Waihi’s current operations.
    • NEM shares are lower amid a broader selloff in mining stocks.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • LF

    LeapFrog up 9.4% on strong volume

    • LeapFrog (NYSE:LF) has surged on volume of 1.63M shares, nearly twice a 3-month daily average of 818K. No major news has hit the wires.
    • The maker of children's tablets/learning toys is less than 3 weeks removed from announcing its FQ4 report will be delayed due to an accounting review - no new earnings date has been given - and seeing its shares sell off in response. They went into trading today just $0.03 away from a 52-week low of $1.98.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 3 Comments
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Hometown rallies while former parent trades weak

    • Sears Holdings (SHLD -4.7%) is lower while former unit Sears Hometown and Outlet Stores (SHOS +22.9%) rallies strongly after earnings.
    • Sears Hometown noted it paid lower commissions for online transactions to Sears Holdings in Q1, although retail analysts think there's more to the wide divergence in shares today.
    • Previously: Sears Hometown and Outlet reports Q1 results (June 5)
    • Previously: More on Sears Hometown and Outlet Stores' Q1 (June 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • JMU

    WoWo merging with online food service firm; shares -8.8%

    • WOWO is merging with JMU, a Chinese firm declared to provide the largest online B2B platform for the country's food service industry. WoWo is paying $30M in cash and issuing 741M ordinary shares; JMU's shareholders will own 50% of the post-merger company.
    • In addition, WoWo is selling 72M shares to chairman/CEO Madong Xu at $10 apiece - 17% below yesterday's close. Xu will own 25.3% of the post-merger company, and JMU co-founders Xiaoxia Zhu and Huimin Wang will respectively own 14.7% and 10.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice up 5.9% on pre-earnings B. Riley upgrade

    • B. Riley has upgraded Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD) to Buy ahead of Wednesday's FQ4 report, and set an $8.50 target.
    • The upgrade came with the online reviews/engagement tool provider's shares down 29% YTD going into today. They tumbled in March due to the soft FY16 guidance provided with an FQ3 beat.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • CZR

    Caesars Entertainment hits 52-week low amid legal wrangling

    • Caesars Entertainment (CZR -12.3%) is sharply lower on more concerns litigation will hold back restructuring efforts.
    • Creditors are battling to advance four separate lawsuits against the company over the transfer of assets to its operating unit.
    • The timing of a ruling on the legality of the transfers isn't known.
    • Shares of CZR reached a 52-week low of $5.95 before recovering a bit.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks rally following JA's buyout offer, Yingli's results

    • Solar stocks are doing well (TAN +1.1%) on a quiet morning for equities after JA Solar disclosed a going-private offer from its CEO, and beaten-down Yingli provided mixed Q1 results (revenue beat, EPS missed) and better-than-feared guidance.
    • Aside from JA/Yingli, gainers include First Solar (FSLR +3.4%), Canadian Solar (CSIQ +3.6%), JinkoSolar (JKS +4.1%), ReneSola (SOL +10.8%), China Sunergy (CSUN +5.4%), Trina (TSL +3%), Sky Solar (SKYS +2.9%), and Daqo (DQ +4.2%).
    • Chinese solar names might also be benefiting from an overnight rally in Shanghai (see Chinese Internet stocks). First Solar, meanwhile, has seen a (questionable) rumor about a Wal-Mart buyout offer surface.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 8 Comments
  • IMPV

    Cybersecurity stocks jump on federal hack

    • The PureFunds ISE Cyber Security ETF (HACK +2.2%) has made fresh highs after government officials disclosed a hack of the federal Office of Personnel Management (OPM) that resulted in the personal records of as many as 4M current and former federal workers being stolen. The Chinese hackers who carried out for a recent attack on health insurance firms Anthem and Premera Blue Cross are believed to be responsible.
    • In addition to FireEye, Palo Alto Networks, and CyberArk (previously covered), gainers include Imperva (IMPV +3.7%), KEYW Holding (KEYW +7.5%), Fortinet (FTNT +2.3%), Proofpoint (PFPT +4.3%), Vasco (VDSI-OLD +3%), and Identiv (INVE +2.8%). Fortinet, Proofpoint, and Imperva have made new highs. The Nasdaq is close to breakeven.
    • The group also rallied on Wednesday, a day after the IRS promised to upgrade its security systems during Senate hearings about a recent breach. Proofpoint is a day removed from announcing a refresh (version 3.0) of its threat-response/intelligence software platform. New features include better cloud-based threat intelligence tools and security alert integration for 3rd-party software tools.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 10 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CNIT-OLD +21%. MLP +13%. EVH +11%. WHZ +11%. HQCL +11%. CBMG +10%. CORI +10%. PXLW +10%. TANH +10%. SOL +10%.
    • Losers: LTBR -19%. CZR -12%. LE -12%. ERN -11%. WOWO -10%. INAP -10%. NEWM -9%. COHU -9%. LIFE -8%. FUR -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 9 Comments
  • QIHU

    Chinese Internet stocks surge as Shanghai tops 5K

    • In what's now a familiar story, U.S.-traded Chinese Internet stocks are posting big gains following an overnight rally in the Middle Kingdom: The Shanghai Composite rose 1.5%, topping 5,000 for the first time since 2008. The Nasdaq is nearly flat.
    • Big gainers include Qihoo (QIHU +7.5%), Bitauto (BITA +5.8%), JD.com (JD +4%), YY (YY +4.9%), 58.com (WUBA +3.9%), Sina (SINA +7.8%), Weibo (WB +4.8%), 500.com (WBAI +9.9%), Jumei (JMEI +4.3%), Sky-mobi (MOBI +4.3%), iDreamSky (DSKY +5.3%), E-House (EJ +3.6%), and Leju (LEJU +4%). Qunar is also up strongly after downsizing and pricing a stock offering.
    • Sina and Weibo are now respectively up 39% and 22% since Sina CEO Charles Chao announced on Monday he's investing $456M in Sina.
    • ETFs: KWEB, CQQQ, QQQC-OLD
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 7 Comments
  • PTN

    Positive Ad Comm vote for rival "Viagra for women" drug stokes Palatin Tech

    • Thinly traded nano cap Palatin Technologies (PTN +35.6%) jumps on a whopping 124x surge in volume (over 17M shares) in response to improved prospects for its lead product candidate, bremelanotide, for the treatment of female sexual dysfunction, specifically hypoactive sexual desire disorder (HSDD).
    • The bullish outlook was stoked by yesterday's positive vote by two FDA advisory committees for Sprout Pharmaceuticals' flibanserin (the third attempt seeking approval) for the treatment HSDD, a condition affecting ~7% of premenopausal women. Flibanserin was developed by Boehringer Ingelheim but its New Drug Application (NDA) was rejected in 2010. It then licensed flibanserin to Sprout whose resubmitted NDA was rejected in 2013. The drug works by inducing chemicals in the brain such as serotonin and dopamine. Its specific mechanism of action in HSDD is unknown. Sprout agreed not to advertise on television or radio to consumers for 18 months in order to mitigate the anticipated stampede for the drug.
    • Bremelanotide, currently in Phase 3 development, is a melanocortin agonist that is a synthetic peptide analog of the naturally occurring hormone alpha-MSH. Its mechanism of action involves activating endogenous melanocortin hormone pathways involved in sexual arousal. Final data collection in the Phase 3 trial is projected for June 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • PBF

    PBF Energy +3.5% as Howard Weil upgrades to Focus Stock

    • PBF Energy (PBF +3.5%) is upgraded to Focus Stock from Sector Outperform with a $35 price target, raised from $32, at Howard Weil, which notes that it has lacked a Focus Stock in the refining space for some time given its listless stance on the group.
    • The refining index performance QTD is down ~4.6% and the firm does not sense strong conviction among investors to make major bets in either direction.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • VOD

    Vodafone -2.2% after dampening Liberty merger talk

    • Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) is off 2.2% today after clarifying that it is talking with Liberty Global (LBTYA +1.3%), but about asset swaps instead of an outright merger.
    • A merger would be difficult considering the size of both companies; it would be one of the largest deals ever on enterprise value. But where would asset swaps happen?
    • Swaps would be best where the overlap is heavy: in Germany, the UK and the Netherlands. But neither company seems likely to give up on the UK, Thao Hua notes. It's Liberty's largest market (and where it draws a chunk of tax benefits), and Vodafone's home. Meanwhile, Germany is Vodafone's biggest sales market.
    • "I do not think Malone wants to exit any of U.K., Germany or Netherlands," Wunderlich's Matthew Harrigan says.
    • Meanwhile, Macquarie's Amy Yong and Guy Peddy point out that "neither Vodafone nor Liberty Global have any track record of integrating wireless and cable TV assets." They had previously described a "more rational" deal for Vodafone would be tying up with Sky (OTCPK:SKYAY) in a content play.
    • They add: "Any deal with Liberty Global would in our view result in a transfer of value from Vodafone to Liberty Global."
    • Previously: Liberty Global up 4.7%, Vodafone up 4.2% on report of merger talk (Jun. 04 2015)
    • Previously: Vodafone-Liberty still good strategy, but not a slam dunk (Jun. 02 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 3 Comments
  • AWAY

    HomeAway +3%; Piper sees a buyout target

    • An acquirer could pay $45/share or more for HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY), argues Piper's Michael Olson. He thinks the online vacation rentals marketplace is especially an appealing target following its recent deal with Priceline's Kayak metasearch unit. Priceline is seen as the most likely suitor, but Expedia and TripAdvisor are also considered possibilities.
    • HomeAway is now up 10% since the Kayak deal was announced. SA author Sramana Mitra argued last month Priceline could bid for HomeAway.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 3 Comments
  • ESL

    Esterline -13% after missing FQ2 numbers, cutting outlook

    • Esterline Technologies (ESL -12.9%) plunges to 52-week lows after the aerospace and defense company reported FQ2 earnings and revenue that missed analyst expectations and cut its full-year guidance.
    • ESL said that while its end markets are "fundamentally healthy," it cited macroeconomic conditions in cutting its FY 2015 EPS guidance to $4.55-$4.80 from its prior outlook of $5.35-$5.75 vs $5.49 analyst consensus; ESL also lowers guidance for 2015 revenues to $1.825B-$1.875B from $1.85B-$1.95B vs. $1.99B consensus.
    • ESL said the 2% Y/Y drop in FQ2 revenues primarily was the result of a $29M forex impact and a slight decline in organic sales offset by $31M in incremental revenue from the DAT acquisition.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • YOKU

    Youku Tudou: No exclusive Marvel deal with Disney

    • Youku Tudou (NYSE:YOKU) is up 3.9% after some volatile trade following a statement from the firm clarifying its role in what it had called an "exclusive" deal for Marvel content.
    • "Youku Tudou would like to clarify that while it has worked with Disney since 2013 on numerous online marketing initiatives in China pertaining to the Marvel collection of movies and TV series, no exclusive marketing deals or arrangements have been signed or concluded by the two companies."
    • Shares were up solidly before dropping to a loss on the day with the statement, and have quickly recovered.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • DIOD

    Diodes -4.9%; Longbow downgrades, cites weak PC sales

    • Believing weak PC demand puts consensus estimates at risk and that margin expansion will be limited, Longbow has downgraded Diodes (NASDAQ:DIOD) to Neutral.
    • The analog/power management chipmaker has fallen to its lowest levels since last October. Shares go for 14x a 2016 EPS consensus of $1.78.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • ESSX

    Essex Rental board partially settles with dissidents

    • The Essex (OTC:ESSX +2.4%) board will allow the nomination of Lee Keddie to move forward, paving the way for his election as a director next week.
    • Discussions with Kevin Casey have yet to produce a settlement, so while Keddie will move to the board, another one of Casey's nominees - Chris Kinslow - will not. Instead, John Climaco will join Keddie as a new board member.
    • Edward Levy is out as a director (he's been there since 2006), and the board will disband its Strategic Planning and Finance Committee (co-chaired by Laurence Levy and Edward Levy and having some notable capital allocation failures).
    • The annual meeting will reconvene on June 9.
    • Related: Essex Rental: Company Up For Sale, Shares Still On Clearance (May 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • DWA

    DreamWorks his 15-month high on bullish Stifel note

    • DreamWorks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA) is up 7.2% and has reached its highest price since February 2014 as Stifel Nicolaus upgrades the shares to Buy after an "exceptionally candid" meeting with management.
    • The analyst firm has set a price target of $34. Shares are trading today at $29.47.
    • Stifel's Benjamin Mogil says the firm came away from the meetings "more positive" after hearing about how DWA management was pivoting after problems of the last few years on movie creativity.
    • DreamWorks' film plans are "more realistic/in-tune," Stifel notes, since "2012-2014 film challenges were tied to films which skewed older right as the box office began to see changes whereby animation demand was increasingly skewing younger as kids began to age out of the genre earlier."
    • The studio's TV segment was thought to decline in 2017 after peaking next year, but Stifel now sees that output deals could get extended. For consumer products: "Far more of the revenue target for the year is not tied to feature films, which grants us more comfort with the target's attainability."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • DTEA

    DAVIDsTEA pops on IPO open

    • Shares of DAVIDsTEA (NASDAQ:DTEA) soar 32% in their opening trades.
    • Early buyers paid as much as $25.01 after the company set pricing at $19 - up from an original range of $14 to $16.
    • Retail analysts are mixed on the DAVIDsTEA offering after watching Teavana struggle with demand before being snapped up by Starbucks.
    • The bull case on DAVIDsTEA hinges on its store expansion potential and profitability.
    • Previously: IPO watch: Tea time for hot consumer sector (Jun. 01 2015)
    • Previously: DAVIDsTEA IPO prices at $19 per share (Jun. 04 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 10 Comments
  • YGE

    Yingli +15.6% following mixed results, guidance cut, balance sheet update

    • With shares priced ahead of earnings to reflect major liquidity/solvency fears, Yingli (NYSE:YGE) has surged after beating Q1 revenue estimates (while missing on EPS). The company now expects 3.6GW of 2015 solar module shipments, down from prior guidance of 3.6GW-3.9GW. Q2 shipments are expected to total 720MW-750MW.
    • Also: Yingli say it  has "paid in full the principal and interests on medium-term notes of RMB1.2 billion due in May 2015," and is "confident to repay on time and in full another tranche of medium-term notes of RMB 1 billion due in October 2015."
    • The company ended Q1 with $184.1M in cash, $213.5M in restricted cash, $1.57B in short-term borrowings, $462M in long-term debt, and $274M in medium-term notes. As of today, it has "approximately RMB6,817 million in unutilized short-term lines of credit and approximately RMB1,243 million in committed long-term facilities that can be drawn down in the near future."
    • Business performance/financials: Module shipments +19.6% Y/Y to 754.2MW. Gross margin fell to 14.1% from Q4's 16.8% and Q1 2014's 15.7% (hurt EPS). Operating expenses were 16.4% of revenue, down from 22.6% in Q4 and 20.5% a year ago. Yingli's downstream project pipeline was flat Q/Q at 1.6GW; construction began on 94MW of projects in Q1.
    • Q1 results, PR

  • Dollar pops higher after strong job and wage gains

    • The BLS reported a stronger-than-expected 280K jobs gained in May with year-over-year wage growth rising to 2.3%. The unemployment rate unexpectedly ticked up to 5.5% as workers returned to the labor force.
    • The U.S. Dollar Index Bull ETF (NYSEARCA:UUP) is higher by 1.05% premarket, with the greenback particularly strong vs. the euro (NYSEARCA:FXE) and aussie (NYSEARCA:FXA), but also showing sizable gains against the yen (NYSEARCA:FXY), Swiss franc (NYSEARCA:FXF), and pound (NYSEARCA:FXB).

    • ETFs: UUP, UDN, FORX, USDU
     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM

  • Treasury yields surge amid strong job gains, boosted wage growth

    • The labor force participation rate ticked higher to 62.9%. It was 62.8% a month ago and a year ago. The employment-to-population rate is 59.4% vs. 59.3% in May and 58.9% a year ago.
    • The average workweek of 34.5 hours is flat from a month earlier. Average hourly earnings of $24.96 is up $0.08 on the month and 2.3% from a year ago.
    • In addition to April's revision downward of 2K jobs, March's 85K print is revised higher to 119K. Over the last three months, job gains have averaged 207K per month.
    • The broader U-6 unemployment rate of 10.8% is flat from April; one year ago is was at 12.1%.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield zooms higher in response to the strong job creation (280K), not to mention stronger wage growth. It's now up 11 bps on the session to 2.42%. TLT -1.1%, TBT +2.2%
    • Previously: Jobs up 280K in May; UE rate ticks higher (June 5)
